medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient experienced inguinal pain and swelling for approximately 3 weeks prior to admission. On the morning of admission, she fell down the stairs and struck her head, leading to a hematoma on the forehead without loss of consciousness. Two hours later, she fell again, showing signs of moaning, frothing at the mouth, and tonicâ€“clonic movements that lasted 30 to 60 seconds, along with urinary incontinence and vomiting. The movements resolved spontaneously.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Bilateral inguinal herniorrhaphies 9 months earlier. Recent discomfort and swelling in the left inguinal region after a 2-month visit to Puerto Rico.
medical_history.family_history: Father had hypertension; other relatives had asthma. No family history of seizures or other neurologic diseases.
medical_history.social_history: The patient lived with her mother, stepfather, and siblings in an urban area. Recent exposure to mosquitoes, stray kittens, and a pet dog during a visit to Puerto Rico.
